title: Zilean is good, don't understand his low play rate.
body: Zilean has tons of damage, scaling, utility, and maybe the best cc out of all the mid laners. I'm putting together some good win-streaks with him. One thing I noticed he has great synergies with junglers/ganking. His early game is painful (so I'm guessing that's part of the reason he isnt played that much). But, beyond that I don't understand his low play-rate.

replies.body: Have you considered the glaring detail, that he might very well just be incredibly boring?

I wonder how many people have dodged just because they got Zilean in ARAM.
This champion literally has NOTHING to do with the concept of time. He basically another enchanter.

> [{quoted}](name=Crimson Zeppelin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=btWZl4tt,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-11-22T03:04:23.777+0000)
> This champion literally has NOTHING to do with the concept of time. He basically another enchanter.

What? All of his abilities are to do with "the concept of time" also he is one of the strongest characters in ARAM and if there were statistics for it I would bet when people get Ziliean they don't dodge in ARAM very often. That might just be you and/or your friends.

The speed up and slow down are time-oriented, his W is a time skip for all of his other abilities, his ult turns back time on an ally if they die, and his Q is a time bomb that freezes time if you land 2 of them on the same target.

Also, I agree with everyone else, the champ is incredibly boring, but to say he is not time-related at all is down-right dumb. Also, he IS an enchanter, but if there was a "time guy" role he would probably be in it with Ekko. But for obvious reasons, there isn't that kind of role because only two people would have it.


Edit: Just checked and Zilean has one of the higher pick-rates on ARAM https://lolalytics.com/aram/worldwide/platinum/plus/champions/

8.7 pick rate which is relatively high for ARAM

Speeding up and slowing is a very poor representation of time. They are just running faster.
W is a non visual "spell reload". And what the hell even IS his Q. It's got nothing to do with time. How on earth can you EXPLODE someone with TIME? And to top it all, Zilean literally has ZERO to none animations when casting his skills.
And people DO dodge when they get Zilean in ARAM. Why do you agree he is boring, then say its a blast to play him, while you know you will be stuck with a boring champion for 20 mins without your free will?
Boring AF, he has one actual ability.

His kit is outdated and feels awkward to play.

Q needs to be changed to auto cast at max range if you attempt to cast it outside max range.

W needs to be changed to just be a passive; i should be able to press QQ or EE instead of QWQ, as the W press doesnt always trigger when done quickly. If i attempt to use a spell off cooldown, auto use W if its up.

Just clean up his gameplay.
Well, for me, Zilean is probably the most fun champion of all.
In this current era, everyone here just wants to become a Naruto wannabe, hence the mass amount of Yasuo & Zed playrates.
I find him boring, but I think the biggest issue is : Making the best of his ult since you depend way too much on the ally you use it on, which is NOT solo queue friendly.

How the fuck is zilean boring? You can pull off great AOE stuns, bait your ultimate, and bring a ton of utility to your team. If you play him support, he is literally the only champion that you switch the ability your are maxing midway through the game. you actually have to plan what you do during the game. Not only that but you can zoom around the map. He is one of the most unique champions in the game.

I even play him sometimes and he still puts me to sleep. The most enjoyment I get out of Zilean is taunting the enemy champion(s) by slowing them down and speeding up just to run in circles around them.

Also, no?
Good Kayns switch to W after 3 points in Q if planning on Rhaast. Kassadin decides after 3 in Q to max E or not. Shaco's whole thing was 3 points Q and max W or E.
People said the same thing about my {{champion:40}} . Dont worry about it. Enjoy him! I might consider picking him up for season 10, we'll have to see. I gotta practice him a bit more

Not flashy to watch, boring to play, and simply that has always had some level of influence of champions being allowed to stay relatively strong without nerfs. As the boring game play deters the abuse of any of the strengths the champion provides.
